ratings.comment: Did not give additional help even when approached face-to-face. Good lecturer but that is about it. It was as if students were a bother at times rather than her reason for being there. Burn out?

I took Anatomy 328/329. I found her kind, helpful, and willing to discuss topics with you after lecture. Not to mention that her lectures were hilarious and informative. There's a lot to learn in a short period of time, so you'll have to really work for it, but that's the subject matter and not her fault. Best professor I've had.

Karen and the other anatomy professors are very clear cut on their expectations. Anatomy can be boring to learn at some times, and there's ALOT of information you have to learn. Given this, the profs are very clear about their expectations and throw in some im some interesting info to break up the lectures. Also there's no need to get a textbook!

Karen organizes her lectures poorly. It's very much her class and it's clear that students aren't important to her. Isn't willing to help individually, must post questions for all students to see. When asked how you can prepare better for exams she just says study harder. 3 very very difficult exams and 10 online quizzes. Only take if you have to.

Honestly, its a shame that this class sucks so much as it is knowledge that is very important to peoples careers. Karen was terrible. She and the other professors don't care about you or your grade. There is no outside help, and the tests were just ridiculous.

This class is ridiculously hard to do well in. There is not outside help offered or office hours. Sped through lectures in order to get done early. DOES NOT CARE ABOUT STUDENTS. Honestly, don't take this class unless you have to because it screw your grade over. Don't buy the text book either! completely useless

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Professors do not care about you or your grade! There is no additional help outside of class! No office hours, no discussions, no additional help on Learn@UW. Very poorly taught, very unclear. Reading off slides. Heavy in the content aspect--goes into physiology too much. Exams are not fair based on lecture material.

Karen was always willing to help and is very knowledgeable. Out of the other professors, she was the nicest and most helpful. She is often straight up on what she expects from you and tells you exactly what you need to know! DO NOT BUY BOOK

Great professor! She really knew her stuff and went out of her way to answer questions. Exams were easy if you took the time to go into lab during non-lab hours to study.  By far the best class I have taken! Highly recommended to take coincided with Anatomy 328
dont buy the book

I loved Karen! She was an entertaining lecturer who made the sometimes dry material exciting. The class is only three exams, none of which are cumulative. Takes of lot of studying to memorize the information, but the exams are very fair.

Nice person, fair lecturer. Exams are pretty self-explanatory, lots of memorization. However, she rarely gets through what she needs to and often you end up teaching yourself the end of each lecture. Tends to ramble, but overall decent professor.

Loved Karen's teaching! Very clear. This was one of the best classes I've ever taken. Incredible way to learn and wonderful resources in the teachers. I went in unsure if I would be able to handle the cadaver lab but I left feeling very comfortable and knowledgeable. 100% recommend it!

She is one of the better professors I have had. So entertaining. This class is really easy if you spend the time to memorize the power points. She gives you a lot of quizzes and makes it very easy to study for the exams. Definitely don't need the book.

Anatomy Lab is the BEST class on this campus for undergrads interested in the human body and medicine. Karen is very good and Dave is great in lab. If you are pursuing a career in healthcare you should do everything in your power to get into this class. Take advantage of Karen/Dave in lab, they're more than willing to help and answer questions.

I absolutely loved Krabbenhoft.  She was a very clear lecturer and was hilarious.  The class was very easy as well.  I only used the textbook twice (so dont buy it) and all you need to study is the powerpoints and the practice exams.

Class consists of three, 50 minute lectures a week.  Class is overall easy.  DO NOT BUY THE BOOK.  You don't need it and won't use it.  Use the lecture guide to study and you will be fine.  Got an A and aced exams with very little studying.  Go to class to fill in the study guide and do the practice exams, the Q's mirror the exam Q's.
Pretty good teacher. Knows her stuff

She is an awesome professor! I had her for 328 & 329. Although she could have explained some things better, she was always open to answering questions. Super friendly and approachable. Tons of memorization but that's anatomy. Study weekly instead of cramming. Course notes and powerpoints were all I used-no textbook. If she offers extra credit-DO IT

Interesting class, straightforward.  If you put in the time, you'll get the grade you want.  Attend lectures, follow along with the powerpoint slides, and keep up with the lecture objectives.  Text is a helpful resource, but shouldn't be used more in depth than that. Prof K is easy to approach with questions, answers them clearly & concisely.

Straightforward, well-outlined lecture concepts. Provides lecture powerpoint slides. Study these, complete the "Learning Objectives" packet questions, memorize, and you'll get an A. Only 3 exams (all multiple choice), so you can't miss many. Textbook is an unnecessarily bought reference. Answers questions well in lecture. Lucid lectures.

Great class if you're interested in the material, but you need to be good at memorizing a ton of information to take this.  Do not buy the book, everything you need to know is on powerpoints and packets.  Going to lecture isn't necessary either since everything is posted online...I went twice and aced the class.

Karen is an awesome teacher. Not only is she good looking, but she's crystal clear, makes the material relevant, and explains it very well. The exams are right from the study guides, but make sure to go to class because she occasionally adds things to them. Absolutely awesome professor!

Very clear in what she expects out of her students. Fill out and study the course objectives book and you'll get an A no problem. She's a pretty dull lecturer, but it helps to hear the material in class. The book is not necessary, don't waste your money.

Karen is amazing! Loves her subject and explains it very well. Very helpful and friendly. The exams are pretty straightforward ,so if you put in the time to study and go to labs you'll do great. Loved the class!

I aced 2 out of the 3 exams; if you study the study guide, you'll do awesome. She is great at her subject and explains it very well. It's still a good idea to go to lecture, and the textbook is only used for answering questions on the study guide; no assigned reading. Highly recommend if you like science and are good at memorizing!

Great professor! Exams are not all that challenging if you are a good memorizer. Buy the study guide-it pretty much spoon feeds you answers for exams. Subject is interesting as well. Would definitely take another class from Karen!
Amazing professor. Anatomy's really confusing at times, but she makes everything understandable and relate-able. Loved her.
I cannot say enough good things about Karen Krabbenhoft. Awesome lecturer, extremely helpful, over-all great professor.  Anatomy 328/9 changed my life.

She knows what she is talking about and makes things very clear. Print the slides and you should be able to do well on exams. This class is HARD.. and you only get 3 exams so you can't miss very many questions if you want an A. She is sooooo hot. And has a rockin fashion style.
shes awesome.. and a babe.
